etymology.description: semantic: 田(田) (tián, "field") + phonetic: 丁(丁) (dīng, "man") = area associated with fields -> village or ward
etymology.interpretation: The character 町(町) (dīng, "pavilion; village; ward") combines 田(田) (tián, "field"), reflecting a rural or agricultural area, with 丁(丁) (dīng, "man"), indicating population or administration. This association suggests a geographic division like a village.

examples.chinese: 我参观了著名的町(我參觀了著名的町)，体验了古村落的风情(體驗了古村落的風情)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ cānguānle zhùmíng de dīng, tǐyànle gǔ cūnlùo de fēngqíng.
examples.english: I visited the famous pavilion and experienced the charm of the ancient village.

examples.chinese: 古代诗人曾在町(古代詩人曾在町)，吟诵动人的词句(吟誦動人的詞句)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài shīrén céng zài dīng, yín sòng dòngrén de cíjù.
examples.english: Ancient poets once recited touching verses in the pavilion.
